page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN HARPUR HILL
page.content: The{Safety in Mines Research {Establishment}was established near the beginning of the century to study the cause and prevention of explosion in mines and how to prevent them. Today it is still concened with explosions and was recently featured on BBC TV demonstrating the potentially explosive properties of custard powder! During the war the limestone hills provided safe storage place for RAF bombs. The caves made for them were used by a {Mushroom Farm}in the 1960s. Today {Stowtime}occupy them. The cool dark condiions provide an ideal place to store wine, cheese and other foods. {Sheffield University}have nuclear research laboratories nearby in the site of the old Harper Hill Limeworks.
